comment: I took his course during the summer. There are lots of reading, and several assignments but was very manageable. He explained everything and made sure you succeed in his class.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback--Test heavy

comment: Dr. Wright's class was great overall. He is a down-to-earth professor who truly cares for his student's success. The only thing he is strict on is attendance. Basically, make sure you are there unless you have a good reason not to be.

Dr. Wright cares about his students and treats adults as professionals. This is one of the best classes I have taken in my program. Hands-on, real-world application of data analysis to solve student learning problems. The major project is an overview of data in your school.

This was a great class. The professor was on the ball and I learned a great deal about technology. However, our class was really hard on him. We have some babies in our cohort that really got under his skin. I liked his approach and feel prepared to teach myself. He is demanding but fair. The content of the class was good.

First off, the class is a waste of time. The rubrics for assignments aren't always accurate. There were many times where we had to ask him questions about what he expected in our assignment. His attitude isn't always the best. If I could've taken a different professor for this class, I really would have.

Dr. Wright is an extremely condescending professor who is a know it all and does not like to be wrong. His assignments are tedious and unclear, and then he gets angry when you have questions about anything from the class. Technology evolves, and he obviously doesnt. Its his way or no way.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Dr. Wright is an excellent professor.  He cares about producing solid and effective teachers.  His approach is direct as well as his feedback.  If you put forth the effort to engage in discussions, then you will have an easy A in this class.  His rubric for assignments is clear.  I would take this class again.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Participation matters--Clear grading criteria

comment: Very confusing. It's very unclear what he wants on assignments. He does provide a rubric, but then he grades off the rubric. Grades are inconsistent from student to student.

AWESOME teacher! No reason for anyone to fail this class. Easy A! Took it summer of 2013! Though it would be hard, but it was as simple as 1 2 3. There is a field experience involved where you'll pick a school to observe students. BEST Teacher! Wish he taught all subjects!
Easy, for an online class. Quick feedback and grades posted quickly. Lots of writing; that's basically all u do! One group project-doable and 15 hrs of FE to pass. I would take again.

Took this class online.  You can make an A if you put forth the effort.  Weekly detailed DB postings, one big paper, one big group project, 3 FE labs and one powerpoint.  Super nice and very clear.  He gives personal feedback on assignments which I love.  2 exams that are not a huge part of your grade.  Take him.  You will be glad you did.

Perhaps one of the best professors I have had at KSU. He knows his stuff, but makes you step up to the plate. His humor is dry but wants each student to do their best.  The assignments are straight forward - one paper & one group project. Wished we had more time in class. Discussions made you understand what teaching was all about.

Mr. Wright is fabulous! He makes dad jokes, which I love. He's very knowledgeable. He is also no nonsense. If someone does not like this class, I would argue that they are slacking. It's on their part, not his. Definitely take professor Wright, you'll be glad you did.

WONDERFUL teacher! Really makes you think, wonderful discussions and a lot of respect for students! If you want an intro to educe course, TAKE THIS CLASS! It is a wonderful introduction to thinking about how to be a teacher and what it would really be like.

Great Teacher.  Really makes you think.  Overall, very easy, one paper, group projects and online posts.  He is very good at getting you fired up about being a teacher.  Also, have a field placement in a school.

His lectures are interesting and teaches you a lot about being a good teacher. He was helpful and I can tell he wants his students to succeed. He tends to ask a lot of questions that can't be simply answered=makes you think!! He also give many helpful tech tips!

He's a really effective teacher. Or so I thought. He's fine about telling you when things are due and explaining the rubric. However, He's pretty biased. Make sure you put a lot of BS in your posts/papers because he doesn't like it when you write -To the Point- kinds of things. He likes fluff and repetition. And suck-ups.

Silly jokes. Not sure what his qualifications really are. He obviously thinks of himself as cute and funny - he is neither. You will get an easy A in his classes but you won't really learn anything significant. Take someone else. Doctor Wright doesn't seem to really have much to offer.
Awesome teacher, very helpful, communicates well with students.  Expects you to be in class and to participate.  I learned so much from the activities and really enjoyed this class.

Knows what he is talking about and is very happy to be teaching. He will teach you tons of cool teacher things and make some corny yet funny teacher jokes that most will use when they are teachers. Overall great class just show up and do the work you will get an A and learn a lot.
His class activities were fun.
Fun teacher, expects you to be in class. Communicates well with his students. Assignments are posted online and he is great about telling you what you need to do and when it is due.

Professor Wright is an AWESOME teacher! I loved his class! He is very laid back and understanding, but at the same time he expects you to do the work and do it right! Attendance is mandatory but it's fun going to his class.  I HIGHLY recommend taking Mr. Wright! You will not regret taking him!
Interesting class with Quality Professor!

Excellent teacher! Mr. Wright was always willing to help his students, and it's obvious from the first day that he wants each one to succeed! Be punctual and participate in discussions, and you should have no problem making an A!

I was amazed with this class.  Each time we met, Prof. Wright found a different way to demonstrate to us methods in which to conduct a classroom.  The discussions we had reinforced needed lessons!  Show up, participate in discussions, and you will get an A.  If you have a choice, TAKE THIS PROFESSOR!

GREAT GUY! He does have CORNY jokes...but that is just his way...he does expect students to be punctual and attentive in class...but if you're going to be a teacher YOU need to learn that at some point...VERY HELPFUL! Read the chapters in the book...only two quizzes, group projects and a simple paper...FUN CLASS!

Stay away. Bad jokes in class. One second late, your too late and you get marked down for being tardy. Does not communicate with students. No compassion for students- thinks his class is the only important class. This teacher makes me want to change my major!
